front.title: JSCalendar: Converting from and to iCalendar

section.name: Notational Conventions
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCPÂ 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.
The ABNF definitions in this document use the notations of . ABNF rules not defined in this document either are defined in or .

section.name: Example Notations
section.t: This document contains examples that illustrate how to convert between the iCalendar and JSCalendar data formats. The notation of these examples is such that their main points should be clear to the reader, but their contents can also be parsed for automated testing. The authors of this document implemented a tool that extracts these examples for interoperation testing. The following sections define the notation for such examples.

section.name: iCalendar Examples
section.t: An iCalendar example contains either an extract or a complete representation of iCalendar data. It always represents an iCalendar object, even if the example only depicts non-VCALENDAR components or properties.

An example that only contains iCalendar properties implicitly represents a VEVENT component that is part of a VCALENDAR component. An example that only contains one or more non-VCALENDAR components implicitly represents a VCALENDAR component that contains them. Implicit components are assumed to contain mandatory properties with some value, but the actual value is irrelevant for the main point of the example.

To illustrate this, , contains three examples, all of which represent the same iCalendar data. In the first example, both the VEVENT component and VCALENDAR component are implicit, including their mandatory properties. In the second example, only the VCALENDAR component and its mandatory properties are implicit. The third example depicts a complete VCALENDAR component, nothing is implicit.

figure.name: Examples for implicit and explicit iCalendar component notation
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VEVENT DTSTAMP:20060102T030405Z DTSTART:20060102T030405Z SUMMARY:hello UID:CC0A494A-6E07-4827-8294-0752DD1ECFA4 END:VEVENT
BEGIN:VCALENDAR PRODID:-//FOO//bar//EN VERSION:2.0 BEGIN:VEVENT DTSTAMP:20060102T030405Z DTSTART:20060102T030405Z SUMMARY:hello UID:CC0A494A-6E07-4827-8294-0752DD1ECFA4 END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.t: A line containing just the value ... stands for any other properties that might be present in a component but are irrelevant for this example. This includes mandatory properties. illustrates this as an alternative representation for the examples of .

figure.name: Example for additional properties represented by ...

section.t: A line starting with a single space represents the continuation of a folded content line (). illustrates this.

figure.name: Example for a folded content line

section.name: JSCalendar Examples
section.t: A JSCalendar example always represents a Group object, even if the example only depicts one of the Group entries or properties.

JSCalendar objects are depicted either explicitly or implicitly. An explicit JSCalendar object starts and ends with braces. An implicit JSCalendar object omits braces, it only consists of JSON name/value pairs, separated by comma.

An implicit JSCalendar object is assumed to be of type Event, unless it contains the @type property with a different value. It is assumed to contain mandatory properties with some value, but the actual value is irrelevant for the main point of the example.

illustrates this with multiple examples, all of which represent the same JSCalendar data. The first example contains an implicit JSCalendar object of type Event. The second example contains an implicit JSCalendar object with a @type property. The third example contains an explicit Event object but the Group object containing it is omitted. The fourth example contains the full Group object, nothing is omitted.

figure.name: Examples for implicit and explicit JSCalendar object notation

section.t: A property with name "..." and value "" stands for additional properties that might be present in a JSCalendar object, but which are irrelevant for this example. This includes mandatory properties. illustrates this as an alternative representation for the examples of .

figure.name: Example for additional properties represented by ...

section.name: iCalendar Objects
section.t: allows for an iCalendar stream to contain one or more iCalendar objects. In contrast, this specification only defines conversion for streams consisting of a single iCalendar object. Converting streams of multiple iCalendar objects is implementation-specific. All following sections of this document use the terms "iCalendar object" and "VCALENDAR component" interchangeably.
The VCALENDAR component converts to a Group object.
Its properties convert as follows:
Its components convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the VCALENDAR component:

section.name: JSCalendar Ids
section.t: In many places in JSCalendar, a JSON map is used where the map keys are of type Id (. If an iCalendar property or component converts to a value in these JSON maps, then an implementation needs to choose an identifier as key.

This document defines the new JSID parameter and JSID property, which allow to set a JSCalendar Id value when converting from JSCalendar to iCalendar. If they are set on a property or the component, then its value MUST be used a map key when converting from iCalendar to JSCalendar. If no such parameter or property is set, then an implementation is free to choose any identifier as map key, as long the following requirements are met:

ul.li: The identifier MUST be a valid Id value.
If the same iCalendar object is converted twice, then the identifier for each property or component MUST stay the same, irrespective of the order in which properties and subcomponents are processed.

section.t: In a few cases, an iCalendar property and component may both convert to the same JSCalendar object. Examples for this are the ATTENDEE property and PARTICIPANT component, as well as the LOCATION property and VLOCATION component ...TBD

section.name: AVAILABLE
section.t: The AVAILABLE component does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: DAYLIGHT
section.t: The DAYLIGHT component converts to a TimeZoneRule object.
Its properties convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the DAYLIGHT component:

figure.name: Converting the DAYLIGHT component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VCALENDAR ... BEGIN:VTIMEZONE TZID:NonIana BEGIN:DAYLIGHT TZOFFSETFROM:-0400 TZOFFSETTO:-0300 DTSTART:20010503T000000 END:DAYLIGHT END:VTIMEZONE ... BEGIN:VEVENT DTSTART;TZID=NonIana:20241004T010000 ... END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.name: PARTICIPANT
section.t: The PARTICIPANT component converts to a Participant object.
Its properties convert as follows:
Its components convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the PARTICIPANT component:

figure.name: Converting the PARTICIPANT component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VEVENT ... BEGIN:PARTICIPANT UID:47AD2E1C-49D4-45DF-BD83-8398ACC7D8E2 STRUCTURED-DATA;VALUE=URI: http://dir.example.com/vcard/contacts/contact1.vcf PARTICIPANT-TYPE:CONTACT DESCRIPTION:A contact END:PARTICIPANT END:VEVENT

section.name: STANDARD
section.t: The STANDARD component converts to a TimeZoneRule object.
Its properties convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the STANDARD component:

figure.name: Converting the STANDARD component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VCALENDAR ... BEGIN:VTIMEZONE TZID:NonIana BEGIN:STANDARD TZOFFSETFROM:-0400 TZOFFSETTO:-0300 DTSTART:20010503T000000 END:STANDARD END:VTIMEZONE ... BEGIN:VEVENT DTSTART;TZID=NonIana:20241004T010000 ... END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.name: VALARM
section.t: The VALARM component converts to a Alert object.
Its properties convert as follows:

tr.td: Only if ACTION is EMAIL or DISPLAY.

section.t: The following example illustrates how to convert the VALARM component:

figure.name: Converting the VALARM component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VEVENT ... BEGIN:VALARM TRIGGER:-PT30M ACTION:DISPLAY DESCRIPTION:Breakfast meeting END:VALARM END:VEVENT

section.name: VAVAILABILITY
section.t: The VAVAILABILITY component does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: VEVENT
section.t: The VEVENT component converts to a Event object.
Its properties convert as follows:

tr.td: Location.rel = "end". If timezone differs from start.

section.t: Its components convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the VEVENT component:

section.name: Converting VEVENT components with differing UID values
section.t: VEVENT components having differing UID property values convert to different entries in the Group. They sort in the same order as in the VCALENDAR component.

figure.name: Converting VEVENT components with differing UID values
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VCALENDAR BEGIN:VEVENT UID:DE935D01-3DF7-4201-B61A-D77D05C8B21A ... END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT UID:60BE3D6E-6383-473A-BCF1-3C43EA1FA571 ... END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.name: Converting VEVENT recurrence overrides
section.t: VEVENT components having equal UID property values and all but one of them having the RECURRENCE-ID property set, convert to a single Event object. The VEVENT component without a RECURRENCE-ID property converts to the Event object, all other VEVENT components with that UID value convert to a recurrence override of that event.

figure.name: Converting VEVENT recurrence overrides
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VCALENDAR BEGIN:VEVENT UID:F4257E1D-5461-4EF6-840F-9DFC653EB559 RRULE:FREQ=DAILY DTSTART:20240101T140000 ... END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT UID:F4257E1D-5461-4EF6-840F-9DFC653EB559 RECURRENCE-ID:20240202T140000 DTSTART:20240202T160000 ... END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.name: Converting VEVENT recurrence instance
section.t: VEVENT components having equal UID property values and all of them having a RECURRENCE-ID property set, convert to multiple Event objects. Each Event MUST have the recurrenceId property set, as well as the recurrenceIdTimeZone property if not null. They sort in the same order as in the VCALENDAR component.

figure.name: Converting VEVENT recurrence instance
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VCALENDAR BEGIN:VEVENT UID:F4257E1D-5461-4EF6-840F-9DFC653EB559 RECURRENCE-ID:20240202T140000 DTSTART:20240202T160000 ... END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT UID:F4257E1D-5461-4EF6-840F-9DFC653EB559 RECURRENCE-ID:20240103T140000 DTSTART:20240103T140000 ... END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.name: VFREEBUSY
section.t: The VFREEBUSY component does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: VJOURNAL
section.t: The VJOURNAL component does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: VLOCATION
section.t: The VLOCATION component converts to a Location object.
Its properties convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the VLOCATION component:

section.name: VRESOURCE
section.t: The VRESOURCE component converts to a Participant object.
Its properties convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the VRESOURCE component:

figure.name: Converting the VRESOURCE component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VEVENT ... BEGIN:VRESOURCE UID:456789-abcdef-98765432 NAME:The projector RESOURCE-TYPE:projector STRUCTURED-DATA;VALUE=URI:http://dir.example.com/projectors/3d.vcf END:VRESOURCE END:VEVENT

section.name: VTIMEZONE
section.t: The VTIMEZONE component converts to a TimeZone object.
Its properties convert as follows:
Its components convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the VTIMEZONE component:

figure.name: Converting the VTIMEZONE component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VCALENDAR ... BEGIN:VTIMEZONE TZID:Puerto_Rico LAST-MODIFIED:20240909T122233Z BEGIN:DAYLIGHT TZNAME:AWT TZOFFSETFROM:-0400 TZOFFSETTO:-0300 DTSTART:19420503T000000 END:DAYLIGHT BEGIN:DAYLIGHT TZNAME:APT TZOFFSETFROM:-0300 TZOFFSETTO:-0300 DTSTART:19450814T200000 END:DAYLIGHT BEGIN:STANDARD TZNAME:AST TZOFFSETFROM:-0300 TZOFFSETTO:-0400 DTSTART:19450930T020000 END:STANDARD END:VTIMEZONE BEGIN:VEVENT ... DTSTART;TZID=Puerto_Rico:20080708T130000 END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

section.name: VTODO
section.t: The VTODO component converts to a Task object.
Its properties convert as follows:

tr.td: Also add Location with timeZone and .rel = "end" if TZID differs from DTSTART TZID.

section.t: Its components convert as follows:
See ff. how to convert multiple VTODOs in a VCALENDAR component.
The following example illustrates how to convert the VTODO component:

section.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
section.t: The ACKNOWLEDGED property in a VALARM component converts to the acknowledged property of the Alert object.
The following example illustrates how to convert the ACKNOWLEDGED property:

section.name: ACTION
section.t: The ACTION property in a VALARM component converts to the action property of the Alert object.
Its values convert as follows:
An ACTION property with value AUDIO or any other not listed in does not convert to the action property. Instead, the property converts to the iCalComponent/properties property of the Alert.
The following examples illustrate how to convert the ACTION property:

figure.name: Converting the ACTION property for value DISPLAY
Converting the ACTION property for value AUDIO

section.name: ATTACH
section.t: The ATTACH property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VRESOURCE, PARTICIPANT, or VLOCATION component converts to a Link object. The converted object is set in the links property of the Event, Task, Participant, or Location object.

The ATTACH property value converts to the href property of the Link object. A value of type URI converts as-is. A value of type BINARY converts to a URI in the "data" URL scheme (. If the FMTTYPE parameter is set on the ATTACH property, then the parameter value SHOULD be set in the mediatype part of the data URL.
The ATTACH property parameters convert as follows:
The following examples illustrate how to convert the ATTACH property:

figure.name: Converting the ATTACH property with URI value
Converting the ATTACH property with BINARY value

section.name: ATTENDEE
section.t: The ATTENDEE property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to a Participant object. The converted object is set in the participants property of the Event or Task object.

The ATTENDEE property value converts to both the calendarAddress and sendTo properties of the Participant object. If the URI value is in the "mailto" scheme, then it converts to the "imip" method in the sendTo property, otherwise it converts to the "other" method.
The ATTENDEE property parameters convert as follows:
If no ROLE parameter is set, then the "attendee" role in the roles property MUST be set.

Every calendar address value of the DELEGATED-FROM, DELEGATED-TO, or MEMBER parameters converts to the identifier of an Participant object. This identifier is determined by finding that Participant object in the participants property, which has a calendarAddress property value matching the parameter value. If no such Participant object exists after all properties and components have been converted, then a new Participant object having that calendarAddress property value is created. If multiple Participant objects match, then choosing the Participant identifier is implementation-specific.
The following examples illustrate how to convert the ATTENDEE property:

section.name: BUSYTYPE
section.t: The BUSYTYPE property does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: CALENDAR-ADDRESS
section.t: The CALENDAR-ADDRESS property in a PARTICIPANT component converts to the calendarAddress property of the Participant object.
The following example illustrates how to convert the CALENDAR-ADDRESS property:

section.name: CALSCALE
section.t: The CALSCALE property does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: CATEGORIES
section.t: The CATEGORIES property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or VCALENDAR component converts to the keywords property of the Event, Task, or Group object.

The list of category values converts to a set of keywords. The values convert case-sensitively. Multiple occurrences of the CATGORIES property in the same iCalendar component convert to the same keywords property in the JSCalendar object.
Its parameters convert as follows:
The following example illustrates how to convert the CATEGORIES property:

section.name: CLASS
section.t: The CLASS property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to the privacy property of the Event or Task object.
Its values convert as follows:
Any other value does not convert to the class property. Instead, the property converts to the iCalComponent/properties property of the JSCalendar object.
The following example illustrates how to convert the CLASS property:

section.name: COLOR
section.t: The COLOR property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or VCALENDAR component converts to the color property of the Event, Task, or Group object.
Its value converts verbatim.
The following examples illustrate how to convert the COLOR property:

figure.name: Converting the COLOR property with color name
Converting the COLOR property with numeric value

section.name: COMMENT
section.t: The COMMENT property in a DAYLIGHT or STANDARD component converts to the comments property of the TimeZoneRule object.
The COMMENT property in a PARTICIPANT component converts to the participationComment property.

The COMMENT property in an iTIP-scheduled VEVENT or VTODO component converts to the participationComment property of that Participant object, which represents the source of this scheduling message, if any. It otherwise converts to the iCalComponent/properties property of the Event or Task object.

Multiple COMMENT properties in a DAYLIGHT or STANDARD component convert in order of appearance in the comments property. Converting multiple COMMENT properties to the single-valued participationComment property is implementation-specific.
Its parameters convert as follows:
The following examples illustrate how to convert the COMMENT property:

figure.name: Converting the COMMENT property in a DAYLIGHT component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:VTIMEZONE TZID:NonIana BEGIN:DAYLIGHT TZOFFSETFROM:-0400 TZOFFSETTO:-0300 DTSTART:20010503T000000 COMMENT:take note of this COMMENT:and this END:DAYLIGHT END:VTIMEZONE

figure.name: Converting the COMMENT property in a PARTICIPANT component
figure.sourcecode: BEGIN:PARTICIPANT UID:127ABD62-D07A-4F39-AA62-530E37A8DF78 COMMENT:I'll think about it ...

section.name: COMPLETED
section.t: The COMPLETED property does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: CONCEPT
section.t: The CONCEPT property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or VCALENDAR component converts to the categories property.
Its URI value converts... TBD

section.name: CONFERENCE
section.t: The CONFERENCE property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to a VirtualLocation object. The converted object is set in the virtualLocations property of the Event or Task object.
Its URI value converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.name: CONTACT
section.t: The CONTACT property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or PARTICIPANT component converts to a Link object. The converted object is set in the links property of the Event, Task, or Participant object.
Its TEXT value converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.name: CREATED
section.t: The CREATED property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or VCALENDAR component converts to the created property.
Its DATE-TIME value converts... TBD

section.name: DESCRIPTION
section.t: The DESCRIPTION property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VCALENDAR, VLOCATION, VRESOURCE, or PARTICIPANT component converts to the description property.
Its TEXT value converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.name: DTEND
section.t: The DTEND property in a VEVENT component converts to the duration property.
A value of type DATE-TIME converts... TBD
A value of type DATE converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

tr.td: Location.rel = "end", if timezone differs from start.

section.name: DTSTAMP
section.t: The DTSTAMP property in a PARTICIPANT component converts to the scheduleUpdated property.
Its DATE-TIME value converts... TBD

section.t: The DTSTART property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or DAYLIGHT or STANDARD component converts to the start property.
A value of type DATE-TIME converts... TBD
A value of type DATE converts... TBD

A value of type DATE converts... TBD

section.t: The DURATION property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to the duration property.
Its DURATION value converts... TBD

section.name: EXDATE
section.t: The EXDATE property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to a PatchObject object. The converted object is set in the recurrenceOverrides property of the Event or Task object.
A value of type DATE-TIME converts... TBD
A value of type DATE converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.name: EXRULE
section.t: The EXRULE property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to a RecurrenceRule object. The converted object is set in the excludedRecurrenceRules property of the Event or Task.
Its RECUR value converts... TBD

section.name: FREEBUSY
section.t: The FREEBUSY property does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: GEO
section.t: The GEO property in a VLOCATION component converts to the coordinates property.
The GEO property in a PARTICIPANT or VRESOURCE component converts to the locationId property.
The GEO property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to a Location object. The converted object is set in the locations property of the Event or Task object.
Its FLOAT value converts... TBD

section.name: IMAGE
section.t: The IMAGE property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VLOCATION, or VRESOURCE component converts to a Link object. The converted object is set in the links property of the Event, Task, Location, or Participant object.
A value of type URI converts... TBD
A value of type BINARY converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.name: LAST-MODIFIED
section.t: The LAST-MODIFIED property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VCALENDAR, or VTIMEZONE component converts to the updated property.
Its DATE-TIME value converts... TBD

section.name: LINK
section.t: The LINK property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VCALENDAR, VRESOURCE, PARTICIPANT, or VLOCATION component converts to a Link object. The converted object is set in the links property of the Event, Task, Group, Participant, or Location object.
A value of type URI converts... TBD
A value of type UID converts... TBD
A value of type XML-REFERENCE converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.name: LOCATION
section.t: The LOCATION property in a PARTICIPANT component converts to the locationId property.
The LOCATION property in a VEVENT or VTODO component converts to a Location object. The converted object is set in the locations property of the Event or Task object.
Its TEXT value converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

section.t: The LOCATION-TYPE property in a VLOCATION component converts to the locationTypes property.
Its TEXT value converts... TBD

section.name: METHOD

The NAME property in a VCALENDAR component converts to the title property.

TBC -- need scheduleForceSend on Event and Todo?

section.name: TZURL
section.t: The TZURL property in a VTIMEZONE component converts to the url property.
Its URI value converts... TBD

section.name: UID
section.t: The UID property in a VEVENT, VTODO, or VCALENDAR component converts to the uid property.
Its TEXT value converts... TBD

section.name: URL
section.t: The URL property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VCALENDAR, or PARTICIPANT component converts to a Link object. The converted object is set in the links property of the Event, Task, Group, or Participant object.
Its URI value converts... TBD

section.name: VERSION
section.t: The VERSION property does not convert to a standard JSCalendar element.

section.name: XML
section.t: The XML property in a VEVENT, VTODO, VCALENDAR, VRESOURCE, PARTICIPANT, or VLOCATION component converts to a Link object. The converted object is set in the links property of the Event, Task, Group, Participant, or Location object.
A value of type TEXT converts... TBD
A value of type BINARY converts... TBD
Its parameters convert as follows:

dd.t: This contains information about an iCalendar component that got partially or fully converted to JSCalendar. It allows to preserve the name of the iCalendar component and some or all of its properties and subcomponents.
An ICalComponent object has the following properties:

dl.dd: This specifies the type of this object. This MUST be ICalComponent.
This is the name of the iCalendar component in lowercase.
This contains subcomponents of the iCalendar component. The value MUST be a list of iCalendar components formatted in jCal as defined in .

dd.t: This contains conversion-related information about the component's properties that got partially or fully converted to JSCalendar. Each key defines the path to a property of the JSCalendar object on which the iCalComponent property is set on. The value for each key contains information about the iCalendar property which converted to the object property located at that key (see ).

The key MUST be a valid key of a PatchObject as defined in . The key MUST NOT point into a nested property, unless there is no way to otherwise preserve the iCalendar property elements. For example, if a VEVENT contains an ATTENDEE property, then any iCalendar information about the ATTENDEE property MUST be set in the iCalProperty property of the converted Participant object (see ). In contrast, information about a RDATE property contained in a VEVENT would be located by a key pointing into the recurrenceOverrides property of the Event object (see ).

dl.dd: This contains properties of the iCalendar component. The value MUST be a list of iCalendar properties formatted in jCal as defined in .

dd.t: This contains conversion-related information about an iCalendar property that got partially or fully converted to JSCalendar. It allows to preserve the name of the iCalendar property and some or all of its parameters.
An ICalProperty object has the following properties:

dl.dd: This specifies the type of this object. This MUST be ICalProperty.
This is the name of the iCalendar property in lowercase.
This contains parameters of the iCalendar property. The value MUST comply with iCalendar parameters formatted in jCal as defined in .
